ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Theoretical knowledge, the ways in which anthropology has a discipline has developed over the last several decades, and how theory in anthropology has changed and evolved in tandem.

I have gained knowledge of a wide range of anthropological theories developed in the latter half of the 20th century. In particular, I got to know about theories related with historical anthropology, anthropology of state, and anthropology of modernity.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Appreciated the lectures foregrounding discussion. They were very informative. Enjoyed the presentation and Canvas posting model of the course.

Strengths: The instructor's lectures in the classes are very helpful for me to see the general picture of anthropological approaches to certain topics. The assigned readings are both relevant and interesting. Aspects to improve: maybe some additional readings might be added to the syllabus as suggested reading, so that the students of this course can delve deeper into the topics that interest them.

My only suggestion is to carve out a little bit more time for discussion among students. This could be achieved by making the course a little bit longer or by reducing the lecture by 10-15 minutes, though the lectures were very useful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Very good overview. Shivi is wonderful.
